acknowledgments.summary: Mat Powell of Trend Micro’s Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) reported this vulnerability to CISA.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: COUNTRIES/AREAS DEPLOYED: East Asia, Europe, United States
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: CISA recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-19-213-01 - Web Scraped Version

notes.text: Processing specially crafted MCR files lacking proper validation of user supplied data may cause the system to write outside the intended buffer area, allowing remote code execution.CVE-2019-10961 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Advantech has released Version 2.1.9.31 of WebAccess HMI Designer to address the reported vulnerability. Users can download the latest version of WebAccess HMI Designer.
